I am trying to install Cantera 1.5.4 on a RedHat linux system.  I only
want to be able to use the source code, as I am writing all my code in
c++.  However, when I try to install the package, at the very end of
the  make install command, I get an error.

/usr/bin/install -c License.* /home/s00misr/cantera
/usr/bin/install -c tools/src/finish_install.py tools/bin
(PYTHONPATH=''; none tools/bin/finish_install.py /home/s00misr none)
/bin/sh: line 1: none: command not found
make: *** [finish-install] Error 127

I do not know why this is happening, or how to fix it.  It seems to be
after some of the python stuff, which I do not need.  Will this error
hamper my ability to write code using Cantera in C++?

thanks, 

Anup Misra
